name: Angler's Miami South Beach, a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Angler's Boutique Hotel In Miami was our first stop on our tour of Florida. It is a charming Art Deco building close to South Beach and all the wonderful and colourful architecture that certainly lived up to our expectations. We had a friendly welcome from the reception staff and were given the Penthouse Suite. The hotel has five floors and the fifth floor is one very large suite. It was super, very modern and well furnished with a huge bed and large bathroom. The hotel itself reminded us of a Spanish hacienda and had a laid back ambience, but with much attention to service and detail. The restaurant was good and breakfast offered the usual choices and a constant supply of good coffee. The hotel is close to all the main sights and we enjoyed the night life on South Beach and the shops on Lincoln Drive. You can take a local bus to downtown Miami for a great day out on Biscayne Bay and sail round the 'homes of the stars'. There is lots to do and we really enjoyed our four days there.
reviews.title: GREAT LOCATION TO SEE MIAMI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is excellent if you plan to stay in Miami beach, Washington and 7 th is only 2 blocks from lively Ocean Dr. but you can stay atThe Anglers in a quiet atmosphere. Very well decorated and equipped ,it is comfortable and cozy. The personnel deserves to be highlighted, always at one's service and even proactive to possible needs of the guest. Prices are reasonable and it is worthwile to stay in a high floor of the tower. Excellent stay !
reviews.title: No doubt if staying again in Miami beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is a really fantastic little boutique hotel. For a country that thrives on service, the Angler's go well beyond, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, whilst maintaing a relaxed approach. The food is delicious and our room was great. We travelled with a toddler and were fully accomodated and never once felt out of place because of it. The location is great for Ocean Drive, and about a 10 minute walk from Lincoln Road Mall. We hope to be able to return.
reviews.title: Fantastic, would have no hesitation recommending this or staying again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Loved it. An oasis just off the centre of the hussle and bussle of ocean drive , south beach. Had the family over from the UK for a low key celebration and all worked so well. Pool villa plus a room with jacuzzi, great for the 5 of us. Location great. Pool, small but fine ...so long as no one tries cheap tricks on the limited sun beds. ( one couple did the cheap, gettin up early, staking territory thing). Pool villa rm 108 sun terrace not really useable as only one old sun bed and no shade provided but overall the whole place is good value. W was + 40% and way too corporate.
reviews.title: Top notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel , friendly , helpful staff . Loved our room and the extra touches ie umbrella ,music system . Pool area is comfortable . Great location for ocean drive .
reviews.title: America 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will try to be as fair as possible with this review. I was unfortunately ill when we checked in for our one night stay with bad flu but despite this there were flaws with our stay.
reviews.title: Pleasant but far from perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made the reservation a few days before and called the hotel from the UK because I was having difficulty booking online. The reservation was for a Monday night and I asked if we would need to reserve a table for dinner and was told we would not. No mention was made that the restaurant is not open on a Monday night,We found this out on arrival, something I find very odd - this is after all a hotel, not a motel.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel for a romantic getaway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived mid afternoon to be told the restaurant was not open that day for dinner. We were shown to our room which was on the ground floor by the pool so rather overlooked. We were given a copy of Where in Florida and told there was a good selection of restaurants in there. There was but none were in close walking distance.I asked the very enthusiastic young man who showed us to our room if there was somewhere close to the hotel where we could have a quick meal. He recommended Jo Stone Crab, the busiest restaurant in South Beach where you can wait two hours for a table and hardly walking distance.
reviews.title: Peace & Quiet in Miami Beach ? Yes !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was plush and spacious but quite dark, well equipped to a point, but no tea or coffee making facilities or complimentary water. I found some water in the fridge which I assumed was complimentary but we were charged for it on the bill. I don't understand when a hotel does not have tea or coffee in the rooms. International guests are likely to wake up at odd ours with jet lag and don't want to call room service and wait 15 minutes for a hot drink, it should be readily available and complimentary in the rooms.
reviews.title: Perfect in every detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a rest which was not great because the walls were really thin, I could here people walking up and down the corridor of the main hotel and music in the next room, my husband suggested we try and find somewhere to eat. I looked in the hotel guide under local information but it was blank so I called reception and asked if they could recommend a somewhere close by. The girl replied " haven't you looked in your Where Guide, that's why we give you a copy".
reviews.title: Quiet, Luxurious and Romantic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at The Angler's Boutique Resort Hotel for one night during our weekend exploration of South Beach. The hotel location is ideal, and the rooms are large and very comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, and the bar/restaurant was excellent as well.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, we were unable to partake in the exceptional Sunday Brunch, but we will definitely try it during our next visit to the hotel.
reviews.title: Luxury in south beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to both leisure and business travelers who would like a hotel ideally located near South Beach. We will definitely be back to The Angler's!!!
reviews.title: South Beach Chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We stayed at the Anglers's in 2009 and happy to see that the reviews have remained consistent with my experience. The location in my opinion is awesome in that you are close enough to the beach, yet far enough to not have the traffic and noise of south beach. We were within walking distance of all the entertainment, restaurants and shopping. We only used the car when traveling to other parts of Miami area. It is An oasis within an oasis.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We did not stay in the main building, we had a detached unit, two levels with spiral staircase- so if you don't or can't do stairs-not my reccomendation as bedroom was upstairs. Living area. Downstairs was very comfortable with a half bath. Also best feature was private hot tub! Very romantic...
reviews.title: Oasis of calm on South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: WOW What a great experience. The Staff was great. Felt that everything is possible. We came with a 3 years old daughter that woke up at 3 AM. A front desk worker offered to go to a nearby Deli to bring her something to eat. The resturant is amazing and the Italian resturant in front of hotel (Grazie) is amazing , as well.
reviews.title: WOW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not recommended to have a 2 floors villa with kids. If you want some quiet atmosphere try to take the rooms far from resturant as room 101.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will be back for sure, and will force mt friends to share this experience.
reviews.title: Amazing, beautiful, perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Omer
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Anlgers is a beautiful hotel. The staff are really friendly and very accommodating and we had a great stay there.
reviews.title: Great rooms and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: Close to the beach but away from the craziness on ocean drive. Rooms are large and have a clean modern design. The room came complete with DVD player, iPod / iPhone dock and surround sound system. Wifi is free. Our room had several coffee table books including an excellent one on Florida modern buildings. On the downside the room (which I believe was supposed to have a 'city view') had a (detailed) view of the rooms in the other wing of the building a couple of yards away. We had to keep the curtains pulled most of the time to get privacy. The staff was very attentive, the restaurant is good and when you go to the beach you get a conplimentary bag with towels and bottles of water. You can pay for beach chairs at the reception but voucher is only good for 7th street beach. You can actually get the chairs cheaper t the beach down the street.
reviews.title: Nice small hotel close to the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool is small and unfortunately completed surrounded by buildings - which means you only get direct sun when sun is directly overhead. In january the lack of sun made it too cold to hang out by the pool much. Overall I would come back again and would recommend this place to my friends.
reviews.title: Four star hotel in boutique form

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Btw, the cafe next door - cafe del mar is a very laid back little restaurant that serves good food - much better than the overpriced and overhyped places on ocean drive.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service, room, staff and restaurant all perfect. Let me elaborate on what a boutique hotel is. Small. Quaint. If you do not like this, don't stay here. The pool is probably the size of an indoor pool in someone's home. Almost no sun by the pool. This is if you like pools! Otherwise, grab a fully stocked beach bag at the front desk and hit the beach!
reviews.title: The right choice to stay in Miami Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that, the Anglers and the staff are all quite remarkable, this being my second stay, I would definitely choose it again when in Sobe. Also, you don't have the prices of the Delano or Raleigh here, and definitely similar quality.
reviews.title: A boutique hotel in a true sense....!
The way service should be....
reviews.text: While the hotel's immensely comfortable interior and modern amenities may not be as cutting edge as some other hotels at South Beach, the service at the Anglers is second to none.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some service orientated hotels often try so hard it becomes irritating...you know, where waiters and doorman hang on your every move. Not at the Anglers. Their staff where promptly there when you needed them, but also knew when to give you space.
reviews.title: Way Cool

likes.disliked: — Being too tired to stay up past the restaurant noise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The friendly staff make you feel as though they enjoy you being there. It's nice ! Nothing is too much trouble, their recommendations were perfect and everything was well organised but without the unnecessary fuss.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel, but a few customer service issues...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It's one of my best hotel service experiences in a long time and if I am ever in Miami again, I will return to the brilliant Anglers.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on our way to the Keys and coming in late from Boston. Great hotel in a great location. The epitome of South Beach culture. Chic furnishings, hip help, ipod docks in each room with an amazing sound system. A pleasure checking in and checking out.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, the Angler's is certainly a great hotel there is no denying - having found Miami to be nothing at all as we expected (very rough around the edges and where were all the glamourous, gorgeous people?) - the Angler's was a little bit of tranquility with a European meets American feel.
reviews.title: The best bit of Miami

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas were beautiful, by the pool, the bar, the restaurant and the outside seating area at the side of the hotel - all just great. Staff were wonderful - absolutely nothing was too much trouble and we very much felt fully looked after during our stay.
reviews.title: Love Love Love this hotel!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was lovely, but we were surprised to find things not quite right for such an expensive rate. Things such as a fridge which didn't fit in to a cupboard, so the door didn't close and scraped along the floor creating deep marks in the wood. There was no full length mirror, and in the bathroom the shower had no frosted window, just a blind - which was so strange. A blind in a shower?? Bizarre. Surely a nice vinyl frosted window coating would be better?
reviews.title: Stunning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found there were just a few issues with the finishes on things which would have been more acceptable if it were not for the high rates charged.
reviews.title: Great hotel with beatiful suites and great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of cleanliness, this hotel was great - very clean, modern - and as I have said above - the staff are wonderful.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel - Just Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I've never been to South Beach, Miami, before, so I have no means of comparison, but I know hotels, and there aren't many, especially in the non-chain boutique category, that can compare to The Angler's. I specifically booked this place due to the #1 rating here on TripAdvisor. A warning, though, that if you book through the hotel's web site, they immediately charge a (refundable, within limits) one-night deposit, which I hadn't read in the small print.
reviews.title: Well-deserved #1 Rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After an early morning disembarking from a cruise trip, I called ahead to see if there were any way my room would be available. The gentleman on the phone said unfortunately it wasn't, but that I should come on over anyway. Upon arrival an hour later, the same man (Marc, the seemingly all-purpose valet/bellhop/front desk attendant) remembered me from my phone call, collected my bags, and congenially encouraged me to explore the local area, supplying me with detailed suggestions of where I might walk and dine for the next couple of hours before my room would be ready (approximately 2pm, still earlier than the standard 3pm check-in time). After wandering Collins and Ocean Drive, and a terrific cheap lunch at Cuban hole-in-the-wall Puerto Sagua just around the corner, I returned to find that the hotel had upgraded me to one of the poolside villas. Marc even proclaimed that it would be "way too big" for just one person for a one-night stay. He swiftly took my bags to the villa, which was a STUNNING 3-story townhouse-like "room," complete with a luxurious living room, spiral staircase, two full baths, two huge flatscreen TVs, a better-than-average stocked bar, a king bedroom, two full balconies, and a private rooftop sunning deck. Marc carried my heavy suitcase to the second floor up that rather unwieldy staircase (sadly, I suppose expecting a mini elevator would be gauche in these already over-the-top accommodations). One incident that I believe another reviewer spoke of was the surprise evening visit from two housekeeping staff, who were cleaning my bedroom while I was in the bathroom area. I walked out -- SURPRISE! The housekeeper was polite and extremely apologetic, so blowing my top would have been a tad awkward and called for. Next time, bolt the bottom floor front door. Also, to open the gate to the villa, pull the metal bar up. I was forced to make an embarrassing call to the front desk to find out how to work this strange contraption.
reviews.title: Service is only good until you have a problem with them...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "room" overlooks the small pool and cabana area, making the villa feel extremely private. I was disappointed that I had no companions to share the spoils, and I was devastated that my stay was for a mere day. I wanted to move into this joint. The astonishing rate I snagged: $175 with a AAA discount. I've stayed in literal fleabag "hotels" for more than this.
reviews.title: Best of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was, sadly, closed on Mondays, when I arrived, but I had the entire outdoor patio to myself for lunch on Tuesday. The very handsome and charming waiter recommended the Cuban guava chicken wrap. Insanely good. Again, too bad I was companionless, otherwise I would have tried a unique cocktail at the cozy-looking bar.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: If you need a beachfront property for your stay, you'll be disappointed. However, I am an old fogey compared to these South Beach types, and I require peace and quiet. The beach is two measly blocks away -- you can deal. The clientele feels Euro, but I didn't feel an ounce of snootiness from either the guests or the staff.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been more helpful!
Excellent Service! - Pls. Dont change...
reviews.text: Excellent Staff, Service and big room! As soon as we arrived, we were greeted along with an in-room check-in. They even prepared personal business cards for the guest. All the staff was very friendly and helpful, not snobby at all even though this place has a snobby feel. Room decor is great and comfortable. Food is really delicious also at the restaurant - just dont try to have dinner there if you're not dressed properly, the host wont let you in - i think that was the only negative part of our stay. I'd stay at Angler's again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anglers lives up to its #1 ranking. The location and rooms are great, with terrific beds, sound system, and plasma TVs (although the iPod player didn't work). The staff is very helpful and friendly, which is rare in MIA. And the food is great. We had breakfast there every day, and the French cuisine was terrific (the nutella crepes will remind you of France). All in all, a great base in south beach!
reviews.title: Lives Up to the Hype!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Wow what a great place. Location not far from the beach and Lincoln Road. Great modern spacious rooms at what are competitive if not alittle cheaper than most rates. The service was outstanding. Beautiful restaurant and Lobby. Not the quietest place but otherwise I loved it.
reviews.title: Another Kens Column Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved my stay at this hotel. The room was HUGE, with a king-size bed, sofa and 2 big cushy chairs, bar, large bathroom and TONS of closet space. The best part of the room was the DVD-player (you are even ALLOWED to bring your own DVDs to watch for a change and not spend $15 for a hotel movie!), and ipod docking station that connects with the TV, so you can select your songs from the TV remote on the TV screen. It was great for getting ready with the surround sound music blasting!
reviews.title: Stay Here!!

likes.liked: — The room with DVD player, ipod station, and free internet
likes.disliked: — Small lobby, but they do in-room check in when you get there so you don't have to stand around waiting to check in!

reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
reviews.text: They provided "beach bags" when you left the property, which had beach towels and little bottles of cold Fiji bottled water. Great idea!

reviews.title: A wonderful experience
reviews.text: My daugher planned a short vacation for the 2 of us to escape the Nothern winter. The Angler's staff made us feel so welcome and attended to our every need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was wonderful, the room was wonderful and the location was good for people who don't mind walking a few blocks to find the best restaurants, shops and the nearby board walk along the beach.
reviews.title: service, service, service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will always have warm memories of this place now that I am back in freezing weather and I would stay there again without any hesitation.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

likes.liked: — The hotel and rooms are really well maintained and the staff are great.
likes.disliked: — Would like it to be closer to the beach and the pool is quite small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We arrived on Jan 18 before our cruise to spend a day/night in south beach. We had a Club Studio room for $325 US/night.
reviews.title: Hurry before the rates go up

likes.liked: — The service and the spacious rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived to check in, we were immediately taken up to our room. In room checkin. We were shown how the TV and stereo system work. There are two flat screen tv's, a smaller one in the bedroom area, and a big one in the living area. The bathroom has a big shower. Absolutely everything is new.
reviews.title: Great Boutique Hotel

likes.disliked: — Walking through the restaurant to get to your room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here a while ago now but am intending to return within the next few months.
reviews.title: The most amazing 4 star hotel ever? Unpretentious and relaxing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose a Tower Duplex King with Terrace & Spa. For the same price for a regular room in most 5 star hotels, here you get a upstairs/downstairs, living room, 2 bathrooms, outside seating area and your own hot tub! Definitely value for money.
reviews.title: Great service and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After arriving from London around 11pm, we were checked in within 5 minutes and taken to our room. The room was clean and mini bar/snacks fully stocked. Although the bedroom is not massive it more than amply sized considering you get a downstairs and outdoor space.
reviews.title: Great boutique spot in South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The jacuzzi and terrace outdoors were also well maintained.
reviews.title: Awesome in every way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a great sleep, the shower was powerful and the bathroom was clean. Not what you would call luxury - no bath etc but then I'm not a bath person.
reviews.title: the best place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent five nights in Miami Beach at the Angler's Resort. We felt very welcome right upon arrival where we were taken to our our directly by Luis who gave us all the details and took care of the check in while we were already in our room. The room (King Suite) are large and really nice.
reviews.title: Great location, great service, not so great concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at the hotel was great from the room service to the restaurant and bar. It is always quiet and even if it was New Year's Eve week end, we did not hear anything at night and we slept very well. The pool is also really nice even if it is a little small.
reviews.title: ok, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside was that the concierge was not really helpful when we needed her. She tried to convince us to rent a car to go to the football game claiming that cabs would be very complicated and would cost $200 round trip. She also said there were no shuttles from South Beach. We took a cab to get there and it costs $48. There were plenty of shuttles to get back and we came back for $30. I think that when you do not have a clue, you just say it. She also gave us very poor directions to wait for the bus for a tour we booked with her.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in an Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: Other than this, this is a really great spot and we would return anytime.
reviews.title: Good hotel in Miami Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The friendly staff is the greatest asset of this place and to be commended. However: rooms are generally small and have no view. Only some have outdoor space, facing dark alley, or at best the pool. The 2 level rooms have a narrow staircase making it hard to get around. Little closet space. No drinking water in the rooms, no coffee maker, no turn-down service. Pool is tiny (not for swimming) and at least in winter only one end (about 4 sunbeds) get some sun a few hours a day. No drinking water by the pool either. Restaurant trendy, but expensive. Valet parking 29 bucks/day. I would say good hotel for half the rate, but at those prices does not live up to expectations. Not sure how this ended up #1 on Trip Advisor, sorry.
reviews.title: BEST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED AT!

aka: The Angler`s Boutique Hotel Miami Beach
description: Nestled deep just off Washington Avenue one would not expect to find a unique collection of accommodations and lushly landscaped atmosphere that promises to instill a sense of relaxation the moment you enter. Privacy by design, on rooftop terraces, private gardens and private Jacuzzis. The pool is a perfect retreat to bask in by sun or moon. Unlike most hotels, at The Angler's you will instantly feel as though you are in a friends home, with furnishings, fixtures and services that meet even the most discriminating traveler. Stay a night, a week or longer. This is your new home away from home. Four legged friends are welcome too. Choose your suite for the perfect retreat for family, friends, honeymoon, girlfriend's getaway, business trip, long holiday, special occasion or just a break from the ordinary. This is a charming and lovely taste of the tropics, as never before seen in South Beach. With a subtle mix of international flavor and style clientele from all parts of the globe, all will convene and feel welcome. At once the hotel is discreet while managing to be the center of the attention all at the same time. Energies flow amongst tower suites, garden lounge, and intimate communal pool where relaxing or growing your circle of friends is the order of the day. With a unique approach melding fine island living with historic charm and elegance, we invite you to come be a part of The Angler's. Step into an era of simple yet stylish beauty and sophistication. Spacious Studios and Duplex Suites offer a new level of hospitality that you are sure to enjoy. Set in the heart of the historic art deco district, travelers are invited to take their place in public or in private.
